response:
Investigations should confirm and quantify the optic neuropathy, urgently exclude compressive or structural lesions, assess for demyelinating disease burden, and screen for alternative inflammatory, infectious, or metabolic causes that would modify treatment.

investigations = ["MRI of brain and orbits with gadolinium contrast and fat-suppressed sequences", "Formal visual field testing (e.g., Humphrey perimetry)", "Optical coherence tomography of retinal nerve fibre layer and macula", "Colour vision testing (e.g., Ishihara plates)", "Visual evoked potentials", "Slit-lamp and dilated fundus examination by ophthalmology", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Blood glucose", "Serum vitamin B12", "Serum folate", "Antinuclear antibody", "Extractable nuclear antigen panel", "Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody", "Serum angiotensin-converting enzyme level", "Serum aquaporin-4 IgG antibody", "Serum myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein IgG antibody", "Serum syphilis serology (treponemal and non-treponemal tests)", "HIV antigen/antibody test", "Chest X-ray", "Lumbar puncture for cerebrospinal fluid cell count, protein, glucose, oligoclonal bands, and IgG index"]
